alert.note: Alert for Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 3:44AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Conasauga River near Tilton affecting Whitfield, Gordon and Murray Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oostanaula River near Calhoun affecting Gordon County. Flint River near Griffin Hwy. 16 affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Houston, Bibb, Monroe and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Greene, Oconee and Clarke Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Wilkinson, Washington and Johnson Counties. For the Conasauga River Basin...including Eton, Crandall, Dalton, Keiths Mill near Dalton, Chatsworth, Tilton, Sloan Bridge near Dalton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Flint River Basin...including Lake Kedron Tailrace, Lake Horton, Lovejoy, Americus, Lake Peachtree Tailrace, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Below Lake McIntosh, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin Hwy. 16, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville Hwy. 19, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, East Juliette, West Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Hawkinsville, Clinchfield, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oconee River near Oconee. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and wetlands along the river upstream and downstream from a gage located by a dirt boat ramp on the west side of Avant Mine off Adams Road in Washington County. The water level will be at the top of the boat ramp. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 18.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EST Sunday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 12/15/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
